summary: The bill, titled the Combatting International Drug Trafficking and Human Smuggling Partnership Act of 2025, amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to enhance U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) operations in foreign countries. It allows CBP employees, with Air and Marine Operations authorities, to support foreign governments in monitoring, locating, tracking, and deterring illegal activities such as drug trafficking, smuggling, and terrorism. The bill also addresses emergency humanitarian efforts and law enforcement capacity-building. It includes provisions for paying claims for damages arising from CBP operations in foreign countries, with reporting requirements and a sunset clause on spending authority.
